content.text:
# Analysis of the Main Target Image

## Count & Layers
The structure consists of 11 building blocks arranged in 3 layers:
- Bottom layer: 1 yellow horizontal rectangular block as base, with 1 green vertical block and 2 cubes (blue on top of red) standing on it
- Middle layer: 1 yellow horizontal rectangular block connecting the sections
- Top layer: 1 green vertical block and 2 cubes (blue on top of red) with 1 yellow horizontal rectangular block on top

## Spatial Relationships
- The structure has symmetry with a mirrored arrangement between top and bottom sections
- Bottom section: Green vertical block on right side, blue cube on top of red cube on left side
- Top section: Green vertical block on left side, blue cube on top of red cube on right side
- Three yellow horizontal rectangular blocks serve as the base, middle connector, and top cap

# Required Blocks from Dictionary

I need the following blocks:
- 2× Blue cube (index 1)
- 2× Red cube (index 3)
- 2× Green vertical rectangular block (index 7)
- 3× Yellow horizontal rectangular block (index 12)

# Assembly Order

```
{
    Step1: Move block with index 12
    Step2: Move block with index 7
    Step3: Move block with index 3
    Step4: Move block with index 1
    Step5: Move block with index 12
    Step6: Move block with index 7
    Step7: Move block with index 3
    Step8: Move block with index 1
    Step9: Move block with index 12
}
```

This assembly sequence builds from the bottom up, first placing the base, then the bottom section elements, followed by the middle connector, top section elements, and finally the top cap.
